data.title: Saint Michael the Archangel Parish
data.meta_description: St. Michael the Archangel Parish is a Roman Catholic parish located in the South Hills of Pittsburgh, PA.  St. Michael the Archangel parish was formed by combining two parishes in July 2020 in accordance with the Diocese of Pittsburgh's On Mission for the Church Alive Initiative; Our Lady of Grace Church located in Scott Township and Saint Bernard Church located in Mt Lebanon.
data.text:
ACTSA 20-Part Bible Study Featuring Jeff Cavins

Monday Nights at STB

Starting September 16th 7:00 pm to 8:30 pm

Wednesday Mornings at OLG

Starting September 18th 9:30 am (after mass) until 11:00 am

What happened after Jesus rose from the dead?

You know that Jesus died on the cross and rose in 3 days. But did you know that he walked around for 40 days eating and drinking with hundreds of people before he ascended to heaven? Acts is the exciting story of how the Church got started. We will learn together and discuss in small groups what it meant then and what it means for us today.

Cost: $40 Payable to: St Michael the Archangel Parish. Send Checks To: Tracy Walnoha, 2355 Hidden Timber Dr, Pittsburgh, Pa 15241.

Email any questions to: STB - schiesasander@gmail.com or OLG - walnohat@aol.com
